chapters.title: Introduction to AI-Native Systems
chapters.content:
## Understanding AI-Native Approaches

AI-Native systems are designed from the ground up with artificial intelligence as a core component, rather than having AI added as an afterthought.

### Key Principles

1. Intelligence-first design
2. Adaptive learning capabilities
3. Real-world interaction
4. Continuous improvement

### Historical Context

The evolution from traditional programming to AI-Native approaches represents a paradigm shift...

chapters.title: Physical AI Fundamentals
chapters.content:
## Bridging Digital and Physical Worlds

Physical AI represents the convergence of artificial intelligence with physical systems and robotics.

### Core Components

- Sensory perception
- Motor control
- Environmental interaction
- Real-time decision making

chapters.title: Real-World Applications
chapters.content:
## Applications of Physical AI

Physical AI has transformative potential across multiple domains:

- Manufacturing and automation
- Healthcare robotics
- Autonomous vehicles
- Assistive technologies

### Implementation Challenges

Deploying physical AI systems requires addressing safety, reliability, and ethical considerations...
